error.signature: This job is stuck because the project doesn't have any runners online assigned to it
error.regex: (?:job is stuck|no runners online|stuck.*pending|Waiting for runner|no available runner|runner.*not available|This job has not started yet)

verdict.summary: GitLab CI job is stuck in pending state because no registered runner matches the job's tags, the runner is offline, or shared runners are disabled for the project.

dead_ends.action: Remove all tags from the job to run on any runner
dead_ends.why_fails: Untagged jobs may run on inappropriate runners (wrong architecture, missing tools, insufficient resources), causing build failures

dead_ends.action: Restart the GitLab web application expecting it to fix runner connectivity
dead_ends.why_fails: The GitLab application server and the runner are separate processes; restarting GitLab does not affect runner registration or connectivity

workarounds.action: Verify runner registration and ensure tags match the job requirements
workarounds.how: Go to Settings > CI/CD > Runners and check runner status. Ensure the runner's tags match the tags specified in .gitlab-ci.yml. Re-register the runner if needed with 'gitlab-runner register'

workarounds.action: Enable shared runners or register a new project-specific runner
workarounds.how: Go to Settings > CI/CD > Runners > Enable shared runners (if available on your GitLab instance). Or register a new runner: 'gitlab-runner register --url https://gitlab.com --token YOUR_TOKEN'

leads_to.condition: When runner finally picks up the job but is under-resourced, causing test timeouts

preceded_by.condition: When flaky test failures consume all runner capacity, causing new jobs to queue

frequently_confused_with.distinction: GitLab runner stuck refers to GitLab CI runner registration and tag matching; Jenkins agent offline refers to Jenkins node connectivity
